metadata.title: CVE-2016-6172 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
PowerDNS (aka pdns) Authoritative Server before 4.0.1 allows remote primaryDNS servers to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion and secondaryDNS server crash) via a large (1) AXFR or (2) IXFR response.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6172` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-bind - 4.0.1-1
pdns-backend-geoip - 4.0.1-1
pdns-backend-ldap - 4.0.1-1
pdns-backend-lua - 4.0.1-1
pdns-backend-mydns - 4.0.1-1
pdns-backend-mysql - 4.0.1-1
pdns-backend-odbc - 4.0.1-1
pdns-backend-opendbx - 4.0.1-1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 4.0.1-1
pdns-backend-pipe - 4.0.1-1
pdns-backend-remote - 4.0.1-1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 4.0.1-1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 4.0.1-1
pdns-server - 4.0.1-1
pdns-tools - 4.0.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pdns package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.1-1').
